text: Merion Station (also known as Merion) is an unincorporated community in Pennsylvania, United States, bordering Philadelphia to the city's west. It is one of the communities that make up the Philadelphia Main Line, and is part of the city of Lower Merion Township, Montgomery County. Merion Station is known for its grand mansions and for the wealth of its residents.Jones, Dick. The First Three Hundred: The Amazing and Rich History of Lower Merion. Ardmore: Lower Merion Historical Society, 2001. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Pennsylvania
title: Merion Station, Pennsylvania
